channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Graffiti

item.title: Over hanging tree branches hazardous, 14th June
item.description:
Numerous trees are required pruning as their foliage has overgrown and are not only obstructing pedestrians but also are a significant hazard to the partially sighted. Blind members of the community are in danger and at risk. Please survey Ravenscroft road and other adjoining roads and streets to assess and prune the road side trees to address this hazard. ,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need pruning, 14th June
item.description:
On Ravenscroft Rd between Elmers End Rd junction and Avenue Rd there are a number of trees which badly need cutting back. It is impossible to walk beneath them. I speak as a person who sustained an eye injury in the past from walking into overhanging branches. The trees are very dangerous for the sight-impaired. The problem has been escalating since the spring.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Lee High Road, Hither Green, London

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned car still there, 14th June
item.description:
Saw this was reported 6 months ago but the abandoned car in the parking lot behind Ravensbourne Mansions is still there. Vehicle is SORN and its MOT expired in April 2023. Please could this be addressed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berthon Street, London

item.title: Overgrowth of bushes and thorns from park, 14th June
item.description:
All along the inside of our fence we have loads of overgrown bushes, trees and huge thorn branches. Been trying to keep them maintained but there's too many from the park side. Hopefully we can arrange the rangers to cut back etc?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martello Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Request for fence due to corner cutting and soil erosion, 14th June
item.description:
Some people are cutting across the corner of [specific location], and this has worn down the grass, leaving a patch of bare soil instead of a healthy lawn. This not only looks unsightly but may contribute to erosion and further deterioration of the area. To help protect the space and enable the grass to grow back, I would appreciate if the council could consider adding a small fence or barrier to prohibit foot traffic across the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Russia Walk, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole or badly cracked road, 14th June

item.title: Shattered glass on path & by tree verge, 14th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sarre Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Stump of failed street lamp needs to be removed, 14th June
item.description:
The street lamp outside 47 Hyde Vale failed in dramatic fashion last year, causing major electrical outages on the street. The street lamp was finally replaced this year but the stump of the old lamp - it was cut off above head height - has been left standing and is unsightly. One can only assume that it was left due to the parking restriction sign, but common sense is that it should simply be moved to the new lamp post so that the cut down one can be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Hyde Vale, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess Litter, 14th June
item.description:
On Mayplace Road West at the junction with Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath: Please ask your street cleaning contractor - Countrystyle to remove the excess litter from the pavement and the planter which runs parallel to The Furze Wren Weatherspoon’s Pub. Two pictures attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Place, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Japanese knotweed - a HUGE growth up a wall, 13th June
item.description:
A large hedge-like growth up and over the wall near Lady Margaret House on Westmoreland Road. On the north side of the road - plant App confirms Fallopia japonica, or Japanese Knotweed. Huge and growing bigger..!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
